body: This lets any friend connection, whether from messenger or from conferences, to be used for rejoining a conference. This is how it was meant to work all along. I've also included a couple of tweaks to the conference test in this pr to make it more robust. Hopefully, and as far as my (limited) testing can determine, the conference test should reliably pass with this pr. --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1189)

comment_data.body: `if (status != ...something?)` some constant here? I think this is an enumeration in practice.
Move `i` below the `if` or even into the `for` init decl.
It's not an enum, just 0 or 1. Presumably we'll make it a bool one day. So "(status)" seems correct.
Agreed, but this has nothing to do with this PR.
It does, because you introduce new lines between the declaration and the `for`.

comment_regular_data.body: I'm closing this PR. It was based on a misdiagnosis of a bug. This callback isn't needed until we have saving, so there's no need to cherry-pick it out as a separate PR. I'll submit a new PR soon with an actual fix to the bug and the test changes of this PR. Nothing to see here.

* Thursday, 2018-09-20 at 17:41 +0000 - iphydf <notifications@github.com>:

>It does, because you introduce new lines between the declaration and 
>the `for`.

Ah yes, I see. Thanks. Fixed in the saving PR.
